name: Ext.EventManager
doc:
Registers event handlers that want to receive a normalized EventObject instead of the standard browser event and provides several useful events directly.

See Ext.EventObject for more details on normalized event objects.

members.name: deferReadyEvent
members.doc: Additionally, allow the 'DOM' listener thread to complete (usually desirable with mobWebkit, Gecko) before firing the entire onReady chain (high stack load on Loader) by specifying a delay value. Defaults to 1ms.
members.short_doc:
Additionally, allow the 'DOM' listener thread to complete (usually desirable with mobWebkit, Gecko)
before firing the...

members.doc: Check if we have bound our global onReady listener
members.short_doc: Check if we have bound our global onReady listener ...

members.name: hasFiredReady
members.doc: Check if fireDocReady has been called
members.short_doc: Check if fireDocReady has been called ...

members.name: idleEvent
members.doc:
Fires when an event handler finishes its run, just before returning to browser control.

This includes DOM event handlers, Ajax (including JSONP) event handlers, and TaskRunners

This can be useful for performing cleanup, or update tasks which need to happen only after all code in an event handler has been run, but which should not be executed in a timer due to the intervening browser reflow/repaint which would take place.
members.short_doc: Fires when an event handler finishes its run, just before returning to browser control. ...

members.name: propRe
members.doc: Options to parse for the 4th argument to addListener.
members.short_doc: Options to parse for the 4th argument to addListener. ...

members.name: readyEvent
members.doc: Holds references to any onReady functions

members.name: scrollTimeout
members.doc: Timer for doScroll polling

members.name: stoppedMouseDownEvent
members.doc: Contains a list of all document mouse downs, so we can ensure they fire even when stopEvent is called.

members.name: useKeyDown
members.doc: note 1: IE fires ONLY the keydown event on specialkey autorepeat note 2: Safari < 3.1, Gecko (Mac/Linux) & Opera fire only the keypress event on specialkey autorepeat (research done by Jan Wolter at http://unixpapa.com/js/key.html)
members.short_doc:

note 2: Safari < 3.1, Gecko (Mac/Linux) & Ope...

members.name: addListener
members.doc:
Appends an event handler to an element. The shorthand version on is equivalent. Typically you will use Ext.Element.addListener directly on an Element in favor of calling this version.

on is an alias for addListener.

params.name: el
params.doc: The html element or id to assign the event handler to.

params.name: eventName
params.doc: The name of the event to listen for.

params.name: handler
params.doc: The handler function the event invokes. A String parameter is assumed to be method name in scope object, or Element object if no scope is provided.

properties.name: event
properties.doc: The EventObject describing the event.

properties.name: target
properties.doc: The Element which was the target of the event. Note that this may be filtered by using the delegate option.

properties.name: options
properties.doc: The options object from the addListener call.

params.name: scope
params.doc: The scope (this reference) in which the handler function is executed. Defaults to the Element.

params.name: options
params.doc: An object containing handler configuration properties. This may contain any of the following properties (See Ext.Element.addListener for examples of how to use these options.):

properties.name: scope
properties.doc: The scope (this reference) in which the handler function is executed. Defaults to the Element.

properties.name: delegate
properties.doc: A simple selector to filter the target or look for a descendant of the target

properties.name: stopEvent
properties.doc: True to stop the event. That is stop propagation, and prevent the default action.

properties.name: preventDefault
properties.doc: True to prevent the default action

properties.name: stopPropagation
properties.doc: True to prevent event propagation

properties.name: normalized
properties.doc: False to pass a browser event to the handler function instead of an Ext.EventObject

properties.name: delay
properties.doc: The number of milliseconds to delay the invocation of the handler after te event fires.

properties.name: single
properties.doc: True to add a handler to handle just the next firing of the event, and then remove itself.

properties.name: buffer
properties.doc: Causes the handler to be scheduled to run in an Ext.util.DelayedTask delayed by the specified number of milliseconds. If the event fires again within that time, the original handler is not invoked, but the new handler is scheduled in its place.

properties.name: target
properties.doc: Only call the handler if the event was fired on the target Element, not if the event was bubbled up from a child node.

members.short_doc: Appends an event handler to an element. ...

members.name: bindReadyEvent
members.doc: Binds the appropriate browser event for checking if the DOM has loaded.
members.short_doc: Binds the appropriate browser event for checking if the DOM has loaded. ...

members.name: cloneEventListenerCache
members.doc: Clones the event cache for a particular element for a particular event
members.short_doc: Clones the event cache for a particular element for a particular event ...

members.name: contains
members.doc: Checks whether the event's relatedTarget is contained inside (or is) the element.
members.short_doc: Checks whether the event's relatedTarget is contained inside (or is) the element. ...

members.doc: Create the wrapper function for the event

members.name: fireDocReady
members.doc: We know the document is loaded, so trigger any onReady events.
members.short_doc: We know the document is loaded, so trigger any onReady events. ...

members.short_doc: Fires the ready event ...

members.doc: Fire the resize event.
members.short_doc: Fire the resize event. ...

members.name: fireUnload
members.doc: Fires the unload event for items bound with onWindowUnload
members.short_doc: Fires the unload event for items bound with onWindowUnload ...

members.name: getEventCache
members.doc: Gets the event cache object for a particular element
members.short_doc: Gets the event cache object for a particular element ...

members.name: getEventListenerCache
members.doc: Get the event cache for a particular element for a particular event

members.name: getId
members.doc: Get the id of the element. If one has not been assigned, automatically assign it.

params.name: element
params.doc: The element to get the id for.

members.short_doc: Get the id of the element. ...

members.name: getKeyEvent
members.doc: Indicates which event to use for getting key presses.
members.short_doc: Indicates which event to use for getting key presses. ...

members.doc: Gets the x coordinate from the event
members.short_doc: Gets the x coordinate from the event ...

members.short_doc: Gets the x & y coordinate from the event ...

members.name: getPageY
members.doc: Gets the y coordinate from the event
members.short_doc: Gets the y coordinate from the event ...

members.name: getRelatedTarget
members.doc: Gets the related target from the event.
members.short_doc: Gets the related target from the event. ...

members.name: getTarget
members.doc: Gets the target of the event.
members.short_doc: Gets the target of the event. ...

members.name: on
members.doc:
Appends an event handler to an element. The shorthand version on is equivalent. Typically you will use Ext.Element.addListener directly on an Element in favor of calling this version.

on is an alias for addListener.

params.name: el
params.doc: The html element or id to assign the event handler to.

params.name: eventName
params.doc: The name of the event to listen for.

params.name: handler
params.doc: The handler function the event invokes. A String parameter is assumed to be method name in scope object, or Element object if no scope is provided.

properties.name: event
properties.doc: The EventObject describing the event.

properties.name: target
properties.doc: The Element which was the target of the event. Note that this may be filtered by using the delegate option.

properties.name: options
properties.doc: The options object from the addListener call.

params.name: scope
params.doc: The scope (this reference) in which the handler function is executed. Defaults to the Element.

params.name: options
params.doc: An object containing handler configuration properties. This may contain any of the following properties (See Ext.Element.addListener for examples of how to use these options.):

properties.name: scope
properties.doc: The scope (this reference) in which the handler function is executed. Defaults to the Element.

properties.name: delegate
properties.doc: A simple selector to filter the target or look for a descendant of the target

properties.name: stopEvent
properties.doc: True to stop the event. That is stop propagation, and prevent the default action.

properties.name: preventDefault
properties.doc: True to prevent the default action

properties.name: stopPropagation
properties.doc: True to prevent event propagation

properties.name: normalized
properties.doc: False to pass a browser event to the handler function instead of an Ext.EventObject

properties.name: delay
properties.doc: The number of milliseconds to delay the invocation of the handler after te event fires.

properties.name: single
properties.doc: True to add a handler to handle just the next firing of the event, and then remove itself.

properties.name: buffer
properties.doc: Causes the handler to be scheduled to run in an Ext.util.DelayedTask delayed by the specified number of milliseconds. If the event fires again within that time, the original handler is not invoked, but the new handler is scheduled in its place.

properties.name: target
properties.doc: Only call the handler if the event was fired on the target Element, not if the event was bubbled up from a child node.

members.name: onDocumentReady
members.doc:
Adds a listener to be notified when the document is ready (before onload and before images are loaded).

Ext.onDocumentReady is an alias for onDocumentReady.

params.name: scope
params.doc: The scope (this reference) in which the handler function executes. Defaults to the browser window.

members.short_doc: Adds a listener to be notified when the document is ready (before onload and before images are loaded). ...

members.name: onWindowResize
members.doc: Adds a listener to be notified when the browser window is resized and provides resize event buffering (100 milliseconds), passes new viewport width and height to handlers.

params.name: fn
params.doc: The handler function the window resize event invokes.

params.name: scope
params.doc: The scope (this reference) in which the handler function executes. Defaults to the browser window.

members.short_doc: Adds a listener to be notified when the browser window is resized and provides resize event buffering (100 millisecon...

members.name: onWindowUnload
members.doc: Adds a listener to be notified when the browser window is unloaded.

params.name: fn
params.doc: The handler function the window unload event invokes.

params.name: scope
params.doc: The scope (this reference) in which the handler function executes. Defaults to the browser window.

members.short_doc: Adds a listener to be notified when the browser window is unloaded. ...

members.name: pollScroll
members.doc: This strategy has minimal benefits for Sencha solutions that build themselves (ie. minimal initial page markup). However, progressively-enhanced pages (with image content and/or embedded frames) will benefit the most from it. Browser timer resolution is too poor to ensure a doScroll check more than once on a page loaded with minimal assets (the readystatechange event 'complete' usually beats the doScroll timer on a 'lightly-loaded' initial document).
members.short_doc: This strategy has minimal benefits for Sencha solutions that build themselves (ie. ...

members.name: prepareListenerConfig
members.doc: Convert a "config style" listener into a set of flat arguments so they can be passed to addListener

params.name: isRemove
params.doc: True if a removal should be performed, otherwise an add will be done.

members.short_doc: Convert a "config style" listener into a set of flat arguments so they can be passed to addListener ...

members.name: preventDefault
members.doc: Prevents the browsers default handling of the event.
members.short_doc: Prevents the browsers default handling of the event. ...

members.name: purgeElement
members.doc: Recursively removes all previous added listeners from an element and its children. Typically you will use Ext.Element.purgeAllListeners directly on an Element in favor of calling this version.

params.name: el
params.doc: The id or html element from which to remove all event handlers.

members.short_doc: Recursively removes all previous added listeners from an element and its children. ...

members.name: removeAll
members.doc: Removes all event handers from an element. Typically you will use Ext.Element.removeAllListeners directly on an Element in favor of calling this version.

params.name: el
params.doc: The id or html element from which to remove all event handlers.

members.short_doc: Removes all event handers from an element. ...

members.name: removeListener
members.doc:
Removes an event handler from an element. The shorthand version un is equivalent. Typically you will use Ext.Element.removeListener directly on an Element in favor of calling this version.

on is an alias for addListener.

params.name: el
params.doc: The id or html element from which to remove the listener.

params.name: fn
params.doc: The handler function to remove. This must be a reference to the function passed into the addListener call.

params.name: scope
params.doc: If a scope (this reference) was specified when the listener was added, then this must refer to the same object.

members.short_doc: Removes an event handler from an element. ...

members.name: removeResizeListener
members.doc: Removes the passed window resize listener.
members.short_doc: Removes the passed window resize listener. ...

members.name: removeUnloadListener
members.doc: Removes the passed window unload listener.
members.short_doc: Removes the passed window unload listener. ...

members.name: resolveTextNode
members.doc: Resolve any text nodes accounting for browser differences.
members.short_doc: Resolve any text nodes accounting for browser differences. ...

members.name: stopEvent
members.doc: Stop the event (preventDefault and stopPropagation)
members.short_doc: Stop the event (preventDefault and stopPropagation) ...

members.name: stopPropagation
members.doc: Cancels bubbling of the event.
members.short_doc: Cancels bubbling of the event. ...

members.name: un
members.doc:
Removes an event handler from an element. The shorthand version un is equivalent. Typically you will use Ext.Element.removeListener directly on an Element in favor of calling this version.

on is an alias for addListener.

params.name: el
params.doc: The id or html element from which to remove the listener.

params.name: fn
params.doc: The handler function to remove. This must be a reference to the function passed into the addListener call.

params.name: scope
params.doc: If a scope (this reference) was specified when the listener was added, then this must refer to the same object.

members.short_doc: Removes an event handler from an element. ...
